p: In the short-term, HAART optimism causes a transient spike in the per capita rate of unprotected sex (US) between HIV+ and HIV− individuals in all age groups ( Fig. 4a versus Fig. 2a). There is a corresponding increase in the total number of US acts, driven primarily by older age groups where the HIV+ population is expanding ( Fig. 4b versus Fig. 2b). HAART makes unprotected sex more attractive to HIV− individuals by increasing the utility of US through the parameter d, which in turn increases the number of US offers.
